author: Ryan Sachetta
title: Stericycle to Buy Shred-It International for $2.3 Billion
text:
Stericycle Inc., the medical-waste management company, agreed to buy paper-shredding provider Shred-It International Inc. for $2.3 billion in cash.
The acquisition will give Stericycle a wider collection of services to offer business clients, the company said Wednesday in a statement.
Shred-It, based in Oakville, Ontario, had planned to raise about C$600 million ($465 million) in an initial public offering that was to be Canada’s largest this year. The company offers services to about 400,000 customers in 18 countries and has a fleet of about 2,400 trucks, according to a filing this month.
Stericycle, based in Lake Forest, Illinois, doesn’t plan to use the acquisition to move its headquarters for tax purposes, a maneuver known as an inversion, according to a spokeswoman.
